me.alb_i986.selenium.tinafw.ui

Class PageHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.alb_i986.selenium.tinafw.ui.PageHelper

  • public class PageHelper
extends Object
    Static class providing some helper functions that solve common problems concerning Selenium WebDriver. The static methods are grouped in static nested classes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PageHelper.Form
      Static class providing some helper functions that solve common problems concerning forms.
      static class  PageHelper.Navigation
      Helper methods about navigating the web app, e.g.

      • waitUntil

        public static <T> T waitUntil(org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition<T> expectedCondition,
                              org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                              long timeOutInSeconds)
        Generic explicit wait, taking an ExpectedCondition as a parameter. Times out after the given number of seconds.
        Parameters:
        expectedCondition -
        driver -
        timeOutInSeconds -
        Returns:
        whatever WebDriverWait#until returns
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if the timeout expires
        See Also:

                                               org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Explicitly wait until the given element is visible. If it is, throw AssertionError; else, do nothing.
        Parameters:

        driver -
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if element is visible

      • findOrRefresh

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebElement findOrRefresh(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                           org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Implicitly wait for an element. Then, if the element cannot be found, refresh the page and try finding the element once again. Finally, return the element.
        Returns:
        the element identified by the given locator; null if the element is not found after the last iteration
        See Also:
        loopFindOrRefresh(int, By, WebDriver)

      • loopFindOrRefresh

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebElement loopFindOrRefresh(int maxRefreshes,
                                                               org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                               org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Implicitly wait for an element. Then, if the element cannot be found, refresh the page. Try finding the element again, reiterating for maxRefreshes times or until the element is found. Finally, return the element.
        Parameters:
        maxRefreshes - max num of iterations of the loop
        locator - the locator for the element we want to find
        driver -
        Returns:
        the element identified by the given locator; null if the element is not found after the last iteration

        driver -
        keys -
